title: @Riot The punishment system
body: I had a ranked game 3 days ago where I was playing draven bot and my bard support built attack speed AD and roamed the entire game leaving me to 1 v 2 botlane and I still haven't gotten a notification that he has been banned. Please tell me someone else who reported him got the notification and this kid didn't get away with this unacceptable behaviour. You tell me the punishment system is working? Prove it

replies.body: banned for one game? lol my dude. also it's not against the rules really.

So was the Support Singed main with smite and the Diamond nunu counter-jungler support one trick and you know what happened? The Singed was threatened with a perma ban and the Diamond Nunu WAS banned. I'm just following Riots standards here...

Those players weren't punished after being reported for one game.** They were reported in over half of the games that they played, over a long period of time which prompted a manual review** _(ya know, the one that takes time and doesn't give players the "you got a player punished" notification_). 

That being said, it does look like the bard adapts a different style of play over a number of his games, a style that many (like yourself) would consider troll. If he keeps up this behavior and continues to get reported, it is likely that he will meet the same fate as the nunu and singed supports.

Only the last person to report prior to a punishment actually receives a notification. It's also worth mentioning that the Singed and Nunu were banned after a significant number of reports against them, not just one or two games worth, since breaking the meta isn't technically punishable, but the negative experience they were creating is.

It sucks, but if he is punished (which if he continues such behaviour he will be) then you will not receive a notification, that is simply how the system works at the moment. I wish there was more feedback but there ain't atm.
